snippet: Marissa Mayer’s firing of her top lieutenant, Henrique de Castro, was her first public signal that turning around Yahoo would be far more difficult than some had suggested.
abstract: Announcement that Yahoo chief executive Marissa Mayer has fired top lieutenant Henrique de Castro deflates enthusiasm surrounding her arrival at company, and signals that anticipated turnaround may be far more difficult than many had predicted.

byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
byline.contributor: Nick Bilton and Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Marissa Mayer’s firing of her top lieutenant, Henrique de Castro, was her first public signal that turning around Yahoo would be far more difficult than some had suggested.

headline.main: Bumps on a Road to Revival for Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Bumps on a Road to Revival
